English.Text: Wahenoor, don't tell me you didn't take the bait again that I had specially prepared for today's exploration?
If we are not careful, we can quickly get lost in the mountainous highlands. Kala recently met a private who never returned from his expedition... wait...
Look, over there behind the baobab tree! Two rare Nyalas! Our tourists have to see them! So quickly mark the area on the map.
Zair, I'll bet you a bowl of spices that this footprint belongs to a rhino. Come on, let's follow the trail!
Hey, don't dawdle, Isaac, we have to be back before sunset. I don't want to encounter a pride of lions in the dark.
The view from up here should be a highlight on our new safari. Don't you think so, Zair? Endless expanses, huge herds of zebras, wildebeests, elephants...
Let's put some meat bait out here. Then we wait and see if any hyenas come running. Their giggle always reminds me of Kyria's...
Tank filled, engine checked, equipment loaded, Wahenoor we can go. Today we explore areas east of here.
Oh my God, it's hot today. Please give me that bottle of goat's milk! What? You've already drunk it?!?
What is still missing for a unique safari through our blessed country? Crocodiles, Mulatu, crocodiles! Let's head west to the Niongo River, where we should come across a few specimens.
Our map is now quite full of suitable places for an interesting safari, don't you think Wahenoor? We have even discovered Geladas!
Don't go too far into the marshy reed landscape, otherwise we'll get stuck with the bus. You can't miss the flamingos and cranes here anyway.
Where have I left my glasses again? What did you say? On my head?
Wahenoor, I don't have time for this now. I have to go to the town hall for an appointment with the head of the district.
Have you heard? Kyria went out for a fancy dinner with Abebe last night! With Abebe! Surely he doesn't even have a single chronicle at home!
If someone like Ironbright came to Enbesa, everything here would be industrialised in no time. Not a nice idea. What do you think, Isaac?
Our new campaign to recruit foreign specialists already seems to be bearing fruit. Even Emperor Ketema is impressed.
I really didn't think that the new typewriters would be so easy to use. They're just a bit noisy.
Zair, is the gift basket for the agricultural experts ready yet? The ship is due to arrive at 3 p.m., so you need to be ready at the pier. Don't tell me you've forgotten?
The mayor wants an overview of all expats living here by tomorrow. Let's do this right away.
Oh, an office job like this is nice. Not in the blazing sun all day, no drudgery in the field...

Next week we will be attending a trade fair in the Old World for the first time. There we will present the full beauty and grandeur of Enbesa. I have already asked Wahenoor to pick out the finest ceramics and the most magnificent chronicles.
Cleaning schedule for ALL offices, calendar week 37: Monday: Wahenoor Tuesday: Isaac Wednesday: Kyria Thursday: Zair Friday: Abebe
Whoever invented coffee must have been a genius. Zair, be so good as to bring me another cup.
The demand for comfortable accommodation is high. But we don't want huge bed castles here. It is important to us to remain true to the local architectural style.
In the meantime, a hotel on the river was being considered. But the pump operators and farmers opposed this. It would have been too expensive anyway.
We like to decorate some of the room walls with pictures of old Enbesan temple paintings.
What is the most important thing in good accommodations? Fly screens!
Before we turn a new shelter into reality, we first build a small model out of wood and clay to get a better idea of its shape.
Isaac, have you already processed form b2? You know that otherwise we can't continue working with form b3.
Some accommodations even have a small pool to relax in. Apparently this is modern today and standard in the Old World. But I think that's a waste of precious water. What do you think, Wahenoor?
Zair, when you have completed your apprenticeship and are responsible yourself, always remember: crane sites must be compacted.
All lodge modules must not exceed the height of the main building.
Planning for new accommodation will only begin when the management of the lodge registers the need for it and suitable building land has been designated by the town hall.
Whoever invented coffee must have been a genius. Zair, be so good as to bring me another cup.
Where have I left my glasses again? What did you say? On my head?
